verses.verse: We have heard<WH8085> with our ears<WH241>, O God<WH430>, our fathers<WH1> have told<WH5608> us<WH6467>, what work you did<WH6466> in their days<WH3117>, in the times<WH3117> of old<WH6924>.
How you did drive out<WH3423> the heathen<WH1471> with your hand<WH3027>, and plant<WH5193> them<WH7489>; how you did afflict the people<WH3816>, and cast them out<WH7971>.

For they got<WH3423> not the land<WH776> in possession<WH3423> by their own sword<WH2719>, neither did their own arm<WH2220> save<WH3467> them<WH3225>: but your right hand, and your arm<WH2220>, and the light<WH216> of your favor<WH6440>, because you had a favor unto them<WH7521>.
You are my King<WH4428>, O God<WH430>: command<WH6680> deliverances<WH3444> for Jacob<WH3290>.
Through you will we push down<WH5055> our enemies<WH6862>: through your name<WH8034> will we tread them under<WH947> that rise up against us<WH6965>.
For I will not trust<WH982> in my bow<WH7198>, neither shall my sword<WH2719> save me<WH3467>.
But you have saved<WH3467> us from our enemies<WH6862>, and have put them to shame<WH954> that hated us<WH8130>.
In God<WH430> we boast<WH1984> all the day<WH3117> long<WH3034>, and praise your name<WH8034> for ever<WH5769>. Selah<WH5542>.
But<WH637> you have cast off<WH2186>, and put us to shame<WH3637>; and go not forth<WH3318> with our armies<WH6635>.
You make us to turn<WH7725> back<WH268> from the enemy<WH6862>: and they which hate<WH8130> us plunder for themselves<WH8154>.
You have given<WH5414> us like sheep<WH6629> appointed for food<WH3978>; and have scattered<WH2219> us among the heathen<WH1471>.
You sell<WH4376> your people<WH5971> for nothing<WH1952>, and do not increase<WH7235> your wealth by their price<WH4242>.
You make<WH7760> us a reproach<WH2781> to our neighbors<WH7934>, a scorn<WH3933> and a derision<WH7047> to them that are round about us<WH5439>.
You make<WH7760> us a byword<WH4912> among the heathen<WH1471>, a shaking<WH4493> of the head<WH7218> among the people<WH3816>.
My confusion<WH3639> is continually<WH3117> before me<WH1322>, and the shame of my face<WH6440> has covered me<WH3680>,
For the voice<WH6963> of him that blasphemes<WH2778> and blasphemes<WH1442>; by reason<WH6440> of the enemy<WH341> and avenger<WH5358>.
All this is come<WH935> upon us<WH7911>; yet have we not forgotten you<WH8266>, neither have we dealt falsely in your covenant<WH1285>.
Our heart<WH3820> is not turned<WH5472> back<WH268>, neither have our steps<WH838> declined<WH5186> from your way<WH734>;
Though you have severely broken<WH1794> us in the place<WH4725> of dragons<WH8577>, and covered<WH3680> us with the shadow of death<WH6757>.
If we have forgotten<WH7911> the name<WH8034> of our God<WH430>, or stretched out<WH6566> our hands<WH3709> to a strange<WH2114> god<WH410>;
Shall not God<WH430> search this out<WH2713>? for he knows<WH3045> the secrets<WH8587> of the heart<WH3820>.
Yes<WH2026>, for your sake are we killed all the day<WH3117> long<WH2803>; we are counted as sheep<WH6629> for the slaughter<WH2878>.
Awake<WH5782>, why sleep<WH3462> you<WH136>, O Lord? arise<WH6974>, cast us not off<WH2186> for ever<WH5331>.
Therefore hide<WH5641> you your face<WH6440>, and forget<WH7911> our affliction<WH6040> and our oppression<WH3906>?
For our soul<WH5315> is bowed down<WH7743> to the dust<WH6083>: our belly<WH990> clings<WH1692> unto the earth<WH776>.
Arise<WH6965> for our help<WH5833>, and redeem<WH6299> us for your mercies<WH2617>' sake.
